hedline.hl1: NBC Makes Deal For New Auto Race

abstract.p: NBC Sports announces three-year deal to televise new Nascar Winston Cup auto race, Jiffy Lube Miami 400, from Homestead Miami Speedway, starting in November 1999 (S)

block.p: NBC Sports, which no longer has pro football in the fall, announced a three-year deal yesterday to carry a new Nascar Winston Cup race, the Jiffy Lube Miami 400, from the Homestead Miami Speedway, starting in November 1999.
NBC's annual rights fee, though undisclosed, is believed to be between $5 million and $6 million, similar to prices for other new Winston Cup races.

NBC Sports, which no longer has pro football in the fall, announced a three-year deal yesterday to carry a new Nascar Winston Cup race, the Jiffy Lube Miami 400, from the Homestead Miami Speedway, starting in November 1999.
NBC's annual rights fee, though undisclosed, is believed to be between $5 million and $6 million, similar to prices for other new Winston Cup races.
Once we made the decision not to be involved with football, we started looking at a series of other properties and first on our list was Nascar, said Ken Schanzer, president of NBC Sports.

The deal will start Nov. 13, 1999, with NBC's telecast of the Miami 300, a Nascar Busch Series race, followed Nov. 14 by the Jiffy Lube 400. The Busch race will be shown this year on CBS, the last time before NBC takes over.
